abstract: Mitt Romney has argued for a more traditional Chapter 11 bankruptcy for General Motors and Chrysler, without any direct government involvement. But at the time, that might not have been possible.
snippet: Mitt Romney has argued for a more traditional Chapter 11 bankruptcy for General Motors and Chrysler, without any direct government involvement. But at the time, that might not have been possible.
lead_paragraph: Some months ago, I predicted that we would finally move on from the overheated rhetoric surrounding the automotive bankruptcy cases. After all, even Paul D. Ryan supported the Obama administration on this point.

headline.main: Was There a Bankruptcy Alternative for the Automakers?
